intro: Valeriana jepsonii, commonly known as Jepson's valerian, is a flowering plant native to California, specifically found in the coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. It is a perennial herb with slender, upright stems and opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in dense, rounded clusters called cymes. It blooms from late spring to early summer, and its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Valeriana jepsonii is adapted to dry, sunny conditions and is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
